messages.content: ComfyUI-MimicMotion is a custom node for ComfyUI that integrates the functionality of MimicMotion, a project by Tencent, into the ComfyUI environment.
What is the purpose of ComfyUI-MimicMotion?
The purpose of ComfyUI-MimicMotion is to allow users to utilize the features of MimicMotion within the ComfyUI interface, enabling them to generate videos based on reference images and videos.
What are the prerequisites for using ComfyUI-MimicMotion?
To use ComfyUI-MimicMotion, you need to ensure that ffmpeg is installed and working on your system. Additionally, you need to install xformers that match your torch version.

To install ComfyUI-MimicMotion, you need to clone the repository into your ComfyUI/custom_nodes directory, navigate to the ComfyUI-MimicMotion folder, and run pip install -r requirements.txt. The weights will be automatically downloaded from Hugging Face.
Is there a tutorial available for using ComfyUI-MimicMotion?
Yes, there is a tutorial available for using ComfyUI-MimicMotion. You can find it on Bilibili at the link https://b23.tv/McnRUpd. There is also a QQ group (852228202) for further assistance.
MimicMotion is a project by Tencent that allows users to generate videos based on reference images and videos. ComfyUI-MimicMotion integrates this functionality into the ComfyUI environment.
How can I ensure ffmpeg is installed on my system?
For Linux, you can install ffmpeg by running apt update and apt install ffmpeg commands. For Windows, you can install ffmpeg automatically using WingetUI.
